data.title: Disable click sound on command bar buttons when they are activated by hotkey
data.body:
The additional click sounds appears to be a common source of irritation on the playtest.
C&C3 avoids this problem by only playing the click sound when the button is activated using the mouse.

data.title: Actor.TraitsImplementing<T>() LINQ specialization & exceptions
data.body: This leaves the LINQ queries as is, but provides `ITraitEnumberable<T>` which allows for specialization of `Where`, `ToList`, `ToArray`, `First[OrDefault]`, `Any`, `All`, and `Single[OrDefault]`. These specializations usually use one less `IEnumerator` and at most one array allocation for `ToList` & `ToArray` except for `.Where(...).ToArray()` which usually uses two array allocations. The `First` & `Single` specializations provide clearer exception messages as well.

data.title: Crushing dosen't get vehicule veteran
data.body:
EDIT Thx to smitty comment i tested it more and my issue isen't one.

In a game i was surprised to have an apc that did for 1500$ of damage crush and weapon and diden't get vet 1. I was assuming it came from the crushes not giving kills. i realize now that i missassume the prize of the APC and it needs the double of its value to get the veterancy.

I wish i never posted that or that i can delete it.

data.title: Interface locked
data.body:
When scrolling with middle mousebutton pressed, the interface (not Ui) sometimes (very often) locks itself. Cann neither click nor select something or place a building, nothing is possible.
Im able to unlock while giving the middle mosubutten a single press again.

data.title: TD Engineer Description.
data.body: Closes #13720

data.title: Win automatically when you are the last player in the game
data.body:
It's an __option__ request.
I played a 5v5 game where all the players in my team left after "gging" because we were overnumbered.
I was the last of my team versus 5 players so these players "gged" too and left the game.
Finally I was alone versus nobody so I had to destroy every enemy asset to get the correct/normal ending and actually __win__ that game.
With this option enabled the game could automatically give you the victory if you are the last player on the server.

data.title: Stavros / gnrl unit has incorrect/weird sequences
data.body:
This **gnrl:** unit (or Stavros) is useful for campaign missions & 3rd party mods.
In the current release version. The (unused?) gnrl or Stavros unit has incorrect sequence settings.

### **Current Release:**
	
`run:`
`		Start: 8`
`		Length: 5`
`		Facings: 8`
`		Tick: 80`

### **Fixed:**
`run:`
`		Start: 8`
`		Length: 6`
`		Facings: 8`
`		Tick: 100`

Another issues is he looks like he is having a seizure when shooting at a target & also taking incoming fire.

### **Current Release:**
`prone-stand:`
`		Start: 88`
`		Stride: 2`
`		Facings: 8`
`	prone-run:`
`		Start: 104`
`		Length: 4`
`		Facings: 8`

### **Suggested Fix:**
`prone-stand:`
`		Start: 104`
`		Stride: 4`
`		Facings: 8`
`	prone-run:`
`		Start: 104`
`		Length: 4`
`		Facings: 8`
`		Tick: 100`

This may have been intentional. However with my fix he returns fire from the prone position like other infantry.

data.title: Attack command done with LMB doesn't work, if engineer is in the selected group
data.body: I've immidiatelly launched Dune 2000 mod after installing latest playtest and picked Atreides Mission 5. Few seconds later I was attacked, so I've selected some units (soldier, trike and an engineer) and pressed left mouse button on the enemy (I've checked left mouse button commands) and instead of attacking this unit, I've selected it. I've changed to right mouse button, selected the same units and pressed right mouse button on the enemy, and my units started attacking it and they were still selected.

data.title: Unit targeting stutter step.
data.body:
Essentially the units (All units from what I saw) do a stutter step move when targeting units on the move. Tanks are the strangest as they turn their chassies then stop again then move once more. However, if the unit stands still they move to attack the unit just fine.

You can see this happening when you target a unit and have it run circles around the map.

data.title: Allow multiple units to dock at one building
data.body:
Lua scriptable AI is nothing compared to this!
I have tamed this for several releases of my mod and the recent AI reinforcement learning, which involved about 1000 AI vs AI games. (Aircraft and Harvesters are expected to be stable. Not too sure about repairs and mine laying as AIs don't do that but they share code with aircraft and harvesters.)

Unifies ALL the docking: Including harvesting, repairing, rearming, aircraft repairing and rearming.

  * Solves RA2 style multiple aircraft landing in one building. #13654
  * Still susceptible to #9503 but if wait docks are carefully assigned, that can be mitigated.
  * #3089 can be mitigated as well.
  * Supersedes #13714 but I expect that one to be accepted into PR first :(
  * Makes Reservable obsolete.
  * Fixes harvester getting dead locked at the refinery by detecting the dead lock. (My other PR attempted fix in-field one). Might not work if, like 10 harvesters are there at the refinery and no waiting docks are added.
  * Also nudge away some silly units hanging around at the service docks.

I didn't want to touch those many activities but since the dock uses NextActivity extensively I HAD to get rid of most SequenceActivities.

And I came to a conclusion that it is the activity that knows what to do when docking, not the client/host actors. For example, if I ordered an MNLY to dock at a FIX it should move to the rally point after reloading and repairing. On the other hand, if it was laying mines and it came back to the dock to reload, it should reload and continue to lay the mines.

data.title: TD: Change the Engineer description to reflect the vehicle capture ability
data.body: According to the TD rules, the engineer have the ability to capture the tank husks, before they definitively explode (an ability reintroduced on the field mechanic unit in RA). At the moment, in the last playtest, this ability is not shown on the engineer unit description, visible when the mouse cursor pass over the selection cell, during the game. Due to this, the player may be not aware of this skill.

data.title: Move condition timer logic (& some ExternalCondition refactoring)
data.body: This will make expanding trait variables easier as well.

data.title: Better scripting support for Load onto Transport
data.body:
I noticed that loading onto transport isn't easy.
* Either the transport or the cargo can die but, detecting that is all up to Lua side and requires making several functions.
* Detecting if all the passengers are loaded is another tedious thing, especially when there are multiple transport units in the team. That requires another couple of functions.
* Making transport to move next to the cargo is what Lua can't stably do. It needs to find an empty cell that is next to the passenger. It is easier if the transport is on the ground but for Chinooks, CanEnter(cell) == true for everywhere. Path finder would be the best for this but Lua doesn't have it.
* The worst part with Chinook is that it won't land automatically to load the cargo. When it fails to land due to some blockage, the whole action is screwed.

Back in RA2 AI scripting, all these were done in one line of "LoadOntoTransport".

data.title: Yuri Grinder support using DonateCash
data.body:
This PR adds support for animation and sound for DonateCash, fulfilling the requirement for Yuri Grinder.
With the implementation of Type filter for DonateCash a while ago, only a little extension was needed, and here it is.

data.title: AttackFollow supports multiple attack bases
data.body:
In C&C Generals or RA2 (battle fortress), there were vehicles with their own weapons which also let their passengers attack enemies.

This patch allows AttackTurreted and AttackGarrisoned to co-exist in one vehicle. At least, works for Humvee in my mod.

data.title: Fix Mobile not sanitizing target location of Move orders
data.body:
Fixes #13707.

In #13528, the call to `Map.Clamp` got lost along the way.

data.title: Fix harv docking activities getting lost under certain circumstances
data.body:
Supersedes #13407 
Fixes #12715 

See https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/13407#issuecomment-317284882 for an explanation.

data.title: [RA - Playtest] SAM ought to have a single hitpoint.
data.body:
As the only heavy armor structure affected by the new hitshapes it ought to retain a single target point. Rebalancing AoE damage output vs heavy armor isn't happening.

![openra 2017-07-24 16-06-00-05](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2715583/28527240-3a128b62-708a-11e7-8023-de33288b8b8b.png)

Might also be solved through #13675

data.title: [RA] Add Gap effect values to new vision range changes.
data.body:
Was overlooked as part of #13640

Also equalizes SAM Site vision range/gap effect with other defensive structures. 

> The SAM occupying two cells adds to the horizontal vision range but ought to have that as its standalone differential in relation to other defensive structures as opposed to adding onto it a -1c0 vision range to compensate. 
> 
> Playtested as part of http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=83&t=20017

data.title: Move hardcoded ChromeLogic hotkeys to yaml
data.body:
Also enables lint testing.

Depends on #13706.

data.title: Infantry now pause briefly when exiting a barracks.
Add support for queued AttackMove and Guard orders.
data.body: Fixes #13708.

data.title: Queuing Amoves
data.body:
I have been playing since februrary this years and i never been able to queue amove orders.

I mean i would love to use the shift key (or now the hud) to queue some amove allowing my units to follow a multiple waypoint trajectory and staying in attackmove and engaging enemy at any moment.

That would allows to do manual effective/offensive patrols as well, right know i can just make in patrol a unit that will just look enemy units pass by minding its own bizness.

I wanted to know if it's intended that way or a feature to come or a bug. (ultimate case, maybe i did thing wrong and just could't do it)

data.title: (Playtest-20170722) [Attack-]move orders outside the map
data.body:
You can now ask units to go outside the map with [attack-]move orders.
(In the previous versions units were going to the limit of the map if a path was available)
- It's a bit illogical
- Units simply stop moving because they can't find any path
- You can't anymore send a scout to discover the bounds of a map
- Beware of misclicks

On the following screenshots I click outside the top left corner of the map.

__Playtest-20170722__

![openra-2017-07-23t143807347z](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25843400/28500272-78b0c9bc-6fc5-11e7-9575-daae4056a524.png)

__Release-20170527__

![openra-2017-07-23t144235772z](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25843400/28500298-0a568b68-6fc6-11e7-8ef9-c4663ce9c083.png)

data.title: Add support for named Button hotkeys
data.body:
This restarts progress towards moving our hotkey definitions into mod code.  A `NamedHotkey` class is introduced to enable `ButtonWidget` `Key`'s to refer to a named hotkey.  All hardcoded button hotkeys are switched over to this new setup.

Followup PRs will remove the remaining hardcoded hotkeys and then finally replace the hardcoded list in `KeySettings` with a dynamic dictionary using mod-defined defaults/descriptions.

data.title: Add to the ambient sound "Range"
data.body:
In my mod for example i have added ambient sounds to the buildings like the power plant with a low volume generator sound, also radio sounds to the command centers. this results to a sound "overflow" of the game, making other sounds actually "mute" probably from low memory in the system? 

Adding range to ambient sounds, will solve this problem. (i think at least)

data.title: WithMakeAnimation interferes structures with GrantConditionOnDeploy
data.body:
I have a Radar Dome that upon deploy, gets into high power mode and consumes 400 power granting sight range of 30 cells. From the new play test, the deploy now triggers sell/make animations.

This gets in the way of RA2 Super Gap Generators too: deploy to make it consume a lot of power for making wider gap.

Make animation Needs to be conditional or must be filtered by deploy type?
Or better, "Building Complete" (this is what the flag is called in building.cs) should grant a condition.
I have a structure that fires explosion all the time but, it looks awkward when the weapon fires while the build animation is playing.

data.title: FlyAndContinueWithCirclesWhenIdle works sporadically
data.body:
Tested on current bleed. (probably the same as Playtest)

https://youtu.be/U8WsW5MELDU

FlyAndContinueWithCirclesWhenIdle activity is meant to make Migs and Yaks stay in the air indefinitely, but depending on which cell you order them to move, they become idle and return to the Airfield.

data.title: Something has broken touchscreen drag playtest 20170722
data.body:
i play openra on the train to work daily. up until the latest play test i could move the screen around easily by dragging my fingers to the sides of the screen. 

in the latests play test this seems to no longer work. has something changed with the code which moves the mouse around.. 

https://youtu.be/ngtvHfiz-co (working)
https://youtu.be/VZlMuNCzPd8 (not working)

im aware touch screen has never been offically supported but this does rule me and any other players using windows 10 tablets out from upgrading further than the current release.

data.title: Allow Land activity to land mid air
data.body: Land.cs, which is used by Enter.cs (from MoveIntoActor) expanded to support mid-air landing into "Carrier" actors.
